TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IWeakEventListener

summary.span: 为希望通过 WeakEvent 模式和 接收事件的类提供事件侦听支持。

span.span: Provides event listening support for classes that expect to receive events through the WeakEvent pattern and a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks (调度程序) 通过在实现此接口的类上调用方法, 并事先调用方法添加为侦听器来转发事件。 The (a dispatcher) forwards an event by calling the method on classes that implement this interface, and that have been added as listeners by calling methods beforehand. 遵循 WeakEvent 模式的主要原因是事件源具有可能独立于事件侦听器的对象生存期。The principal reason for following the WeakEvent pattern is when the event source has an object lifetime that is potentially independent of the event listeners. 使用 a 的中央事件调度, 可以对侦听器的处理程序进行垃圾回收 (或手动清除), 即使源对象生存期超出侦听器。Using the central event dispatching of a enables the handlers for listeners to be garbage collected (or manually purged) even if the source object lifetime extends beyond the listeners. 与此相反, 使用`+=`或等效特定于语言的事件语法的正常事件挂接会导致可能仍在连接的源持有对处理程序的强引用。By contrast, a normal event hookup using `+=` or equivalent language-specific event syntax causes the potentially still-connected source to hold a strong reference to the handlers. 这会使侦听器引用及时地被垃圾回收。This keeps the listener references from being garbage collected in a timely fashion. 源和侦听器之间的关系建议使用此模式的一种常见情况是, 处理来自数据绑定的源的更新事件。One common situation where the relationships between sources and listeners suggests the use of this pattern is the handling of update events coming from sources for data bindings. 可以使用 WeakEvent 模式来侦听应用程序外部的事件。You can use the WeakEvent pattern to listen for events that are external to your application. 只需为其定义, 在中提供侦听行为, 并使用附加处理程序引用而不是`+=`。You only need to define a for it, provide listening behavior in , and use the to attach the handler references rather than `+=`.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool ReceiveWeakEvent (Type managerType, object sender, EventArgs e);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ReceiveWeakEvent(class System.Type managerType, object sender, class System.EventArgs e) cil managed
Public Function ReceiveWeakEvent (managerType As Type, sender As Object, e As EventArgs) As Boolean
public: bool ReceiveWeakEvent(Type ^ managerType, System::Object ^ sender, EventArgs ^ e);
abstract member ReceiveWeakEvent : Type * obj * EventArgs -> bool

param.name: managerType
param.span: 调用此方法的 的类型。

span.span: The type of the calling this method.

summary.span: 接收集中事件管理器中的事件。

span.span: Receives events from the centralized event manager.

returns.span: 如果侦听器已对事件进行了处理，则为 。

span.span: if the listener handled the event.

returns.span: 在 [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] 中， 处理为侦听器未处理的事件注册侦听器被视为错误。

span.span: It is considered an error by the handling in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] to register a listener for an event that the listener does not handle.

returns.span: 无论如何，如果此方法接收到它未能识别或处理的事件，它都应该返回 。

span.span: Regardless, the method should return if it receives an event that it does not recognize or handle.

remarks.format: ## Examples 下面的示例实现为两个假设事件提供 WeakEvent 模式支持`ClockwiseSpin` , `CounterclockwiseSpin`每个事件都有一个专用 (未显示)。The following example implements to provide WeakEvent pattern support for two hypothetical events `ClockwiseSpin` and `CounterclockwiseSpin` that each have a dedicated (not shown). 此实现为每个受支持的事件调用类处理程序存根, 并强制转换事件数据 (在这种情况下, `SpinEventArgs`这两个事件共享一个事件数据类型)。This implementation calls class handler stubs for each supported event, casting the event data (in this case the two events share an event data type `SpinEventArgs`). 如果接收的`false`事件不是预期的事件, 则实现返回。The implementation returns `false` if the event received is not one that is expected. [!code-csharp[CorePseudocode#IWeakEventListener](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CorePseudocode/CSharp/corepseudocode.cs#iweakeventlistener)] [!code-vb[CorePseudocode#IWeakEventListener](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CorePseudocode/visualbasic/corepseudocode.vb#iweakeventlistener)]

para.span: 此方法用于接收接收方在侦听器列表中的所有可能事件。

span.span: This method is intended to receive all possible events where the receiver is in a listener list.

para.span: 特别是, 如果为侦听多个事件的类实现, 则必须检查传入参数的类型, 以便了解调用对应的事件。

span.span: Particularly if implementing for a class that is listening for more than one event, you must check the type of the incoming parameter in order to know which event the call corresponds to.

para.span: 这就是要作为模式一部分的每个事件都必须具有专用的原因。

span.span: This is why each event that is to be part of the pattern must have a dedicated .

para.span: 并且, 该参数类型为 "常规"。

span.span: Also, the parameter is typed as the general .

para.span: 因此, 若要从事件数据中获取任何特定属性, 则实现将需要强制转换为特定的事件数据类型。

span.span: Therefore, in order get any specific properties out of the event data, your implementation will need to cast to the specific event data type.

para.span: 通常, 在根据类型检查事件标识之后, 实现应调用私有类处理程序。

span.span: Typically, after checking for the identity of the event based on the type, your implementation should call a private class handler.

para.span: 类处理程序可以是非常相同的类处理程序, 用于处理侦听器的事件, 该事件是通过添加到发送程序的事件的常规事件模式添加的。

span.span: Your class handler could conceivably be the very same class handler that is used to handle that event for listeners that are added through the conventional event pattern of adding via to the event on the sender.

para.span: 下面的示例部分提供了大致的实现模板。

span.span: The following example section provides a rough implementation template.
